text: Hot Rodders of Tomorrow is an American national competition where high school students tear-down and rebuild an engine in the shortest time possible. The competition is run by a non-profit organization whose mission is to teach young people about mechanical engineering, and encourage teamwork. The organization has awarded over US$15.5 million in scholarship opportunities to deserving students, including US$4.55 million in 2015 alone. == References == == External links == * Official website Category:Mechanical engineering competitions
title: Hot Rodders of Tomorrow
